result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Marie Ann Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marie Ann Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marie Ann Johnson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Marie Ann Johnson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Counts 3 and 4.
Defendant to report to Probation today May 5, 2016 by 3:00 p.m.
Defendant is entitled to 30 days credit under 973.155.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF592.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF592.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessement and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Defendant to comply with DJOC on Count 1.
-Shall not violate any terms of bond.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days if requested by Agent and follow any recommended treatment.

Probation review hearing on August 8, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, E. Hakes. Except for exchange of child.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Must reside with her parents

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Marie Ann Johnson appeared. Case called at 2:28 pm. There is an agreement. State files amended information. Atty Andrea recites agreement. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to amended Count #1, #2 and 5. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of amended Count #1, #2 and #5. Court withholds entering conviction of Count #1 in favor of Diversion Agreement. On Counts #2 and #5. Counts #3 and #4 are dismissed. Atty's make sentencing arguments. Court orders: 18 months probation w/h
- 90 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs $243.00. On Counts #2 and #5
- DNA Surcharge; $200.00. Only one. Apply Bond
- AODA, if requested by agent
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Comply with terms of DJOC on Count #1
-Shall not violate terms of bond
- Sign up for probation by 3:30 pm on 5/5/2016
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Credit for 30 days against ultimate sentence 
 Probation review hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 04:30 pm.
Filed by ADA Minser. km
Motion hearing on May 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

_X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and  __ Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2500.00  and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S: Mrs. Johnson 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Evan H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Not to possess any weapons.

- Defendant to live at parent's residence

- Report every  Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Defendant to test Monday, April 11th, 2016 at the St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

- Defendant must notify the court if she is enrolled in treatment.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
